verses.text: Then Solomon began to build the house of the \sc Lord\sc* at Jerusalem in mount Moriah, where \add the \+sc Lord\+sc*\add* appeared unto David his father, in the place that David had prepared in the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.
And he began to build in the second \add day\add* of the second month, in the fourth year of his reign.

Now these \add are the things wherein\add* Solomon was instructed for the building of the house of God. The length \add by\add* cubits after the first measure \add was\add* threescore cubits, and the breadth twenty cubits.

And the porch that \add was\add* in the front \add of the house\add*, the length \add of it was\add* according to the breadth of the house, twenty cubits, and the height \add was\add* an hundred and twenty: and he overlaid it within with pure gold.
And the greater house he cieled with fir tree, which he overlaid with fine gold, and set thereon palm trees and chains.
And he garnished the house with precious stones for beauty: and the gold \add was\add* gold of Parvaim.
He overlaid also the house, the beams, the posts, and the walls thereof, and the doors thereof, with gold; and graved cherubims on the walls.

And he made the most holy house, the length whereof \add was\add* according to the breadth of the house, twenty cubits, and the breadth thereof twenty cubits: and he overlaid it with fine gold, \add amounting\add* to six hundred talents.
And the weight of the nails \add was\add* fifty shekels of gold. And he overlaid the upper chambers with gold.
And in the most holy house he made two cherubims of image work, and overlaid them with gold.

And the wings of the cherubims \add were\add* twenty cubits long: \add one\add* wing of the one \add cherub was\add* five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house: and the other wing \add was likewise\add* five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other cherub.

And \add one\add* wing of the other cherub \add was\add* five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house: and the other wing \add was\add* five cubits \add also\add*, joining to the wing of the other cherub.
The wings of these cherubims spread themselves forth twenty cubits: and they stood on their feet, and their faces \add were\add* inward.
And he made the vail \add of\add* blue, and purple, and crimson, and fine linen, and wrought cherubims thereon.
Also he made before the house two pillars of thirty and five cubits high, and the chapiter that \add was\add* on the top \add of each\add* of them \add was\add* five cubits.
And he made chains, \add as\add* in the oracle, and put \add them\add* on the heads of the pillars; and made an hundred pomegranates, and put \add them\add* on the chains.

And he reared up the pillars before the temple, one on the right hand, and the other on the left; and called the name of \add that on\add* the right hand Jachin, and the name of \add that on\add* the left Boaz.
